origin: Old English hām, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch heem and German Heim.

definitions.definition: The place where one lives permanently, especially as a member of a family or household.
definitions.example: I was nineteen when I left home and went to college

definitions.definition: An institution for people needing professional care or supervision.
(in sports) the goal or end point.
definitions.example: he was four fences from home

definitions.definition: Relating to the place where one lives.
definitions.example: I don't have your home address

definitions.definition: (of a sports game) played at the team's own field or court.
definitions.example: their first home game of the season

definitions.definition: Denoting the administrative center of an organization.
definitions.example: the company has moved its home office

definitions.definition: To or at the place where one lives.
definitions.example: what time did he get home last night?

definitions.definition: (of an animal) return by instinct to its territory after leaving it.
definitions.example: a dozen geese homing to their summer nesting grounds

definitions.definition: Move or be aimed toward (a target or destination) with great accuracy.
definitions.example: more than 100 missiles were launched, homing in on radar emissions
